description: Attested since 1822 C.E.; from Latin larynx, from Ancient Greek λάρυγξ (lárunx),  +‎ -itis; surface analysis, laryng- +‎ -itis.

nouns.description: laryngitis (usually uncountable, plural laryngites or laryngitides)

entries.meaning: An inflammation of the larynx, typically resulting in hoarseness.
